sen.e: Kinsuke (Masayoshi), castellan of Yagibashi-jo Castle in Hiki-gun, was skilled in takagai (hawker), left Hiki-gun for Kyoto in 1579, served Nobutaka ODA, the seventh son of Nobunaga ODA, as a hawker in 1582 (Akita Domain family collection), moved to Aizu by following Ujisato GAMO, an adopted son-in-law of Nobunaga ODA, was assigned the head of takajo (a hawker) and pilgrimed all over the country.
